title: Learning image representations for anomaly detection: application to discovery of histological alterations in drug development. (arXiv:2210.07675v4 [cs.CV] UPDATED)
abstract: We present a system for anomaly detection in histopathological images. In histology, normal samples are usually abundant, whereas anomalous (pathological) cases are scarce or not available. Under such settings, one-class classifiers trained on healthy data can detect out-of-distribution anomalous samples. Such approaches combined with pre-trained Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) representations of images were previously employed for anomaly detection (AD). However, pre-trained off-the-shelf CNN representations may not be sensitive to abnormal conditions in tissues, while natural variations of healthy tissue may result in distant representations. To adapt representations to relevant details in healthy tissue we propose training a CNN on an auxiliary task that discriminates healthy tissue of different species, organs, and staining reagents. tldr: 该论文提出了一种基于CNN的异常检测系统，通过对健康组织进行辅助任务训练，使表示适应组织中的相关细节，实现对组织学图像中的异常情况检测。
en_tdlr: This paper presents a CNN-based anomaly detection system for histopathological images. By training the CNN on an auxiliary task of discriminating healthy tissue of different species, organs, and staining reagents, the representation is adapted to relevant details in healthy tissues for effective anomaly detection in the histological images.
